area_name: J: The Man and Mother Corner

content.description: First, admire the communal work of man and mother nature. Next, get psyched. Work up the man cut perfect finger flake from the ground to a chiseled ledge between the head wall and overhanging boulder. Traverse left to the roof boulder's crack using natural jibs or the drilled holes for feet. Work into the crack with a heel/feet on the ledge. Power up, through, and over the crack's thin holds and jams for a high ball top out on questionable blocks. Sustained line with a broad mix of technique and gumption.
content.protection: Def want several pads and spotter. Could be better but landing is about as flat and solid as you could hope for with a quarried route like this. Could be led with gear, maybe top-roped if you wanted to jimmy rig something up.
content.location: Right and down from the porch, you'll reach a ledge you can down climb into the little corner that this beaut resides in. It's a pretty noticeable feature.

pathTokens: J: The Man and Mother Corner

content.description: The far right of the major rock area, right before you reach the crushed rock quarry area. Climb down a few feet or come up from the trail to reach a tucked in secluded little area with one beast of a line complete with an overhanding roof crack and all the potential for an awesome, super hard, mildly highball boulder problem. A mesh between man and sweet mother nature to make a beautiful line.
